Name: David M
AboutMe:
Student at Drake University interested in mobile computation, artificial intelligence and machine learning, and high-performance computing.

Over the summer of 2014 I worked at Drake University on indoor localization on mobile devices. Using machine learning methodologies to predict a user's position based on the sensors embedded in their device, I was able to achieve accuracies up to 0.84 meters on average in a real-world environment. Read about it here!

During my summer 2015 I worked at MIT's Haystack Observatory on a geoscience project, the Mahali Project, which attempts to leverage the computational abilities of mobile devices for science.
